告.definition: (bound form) to say; to tell; to announce; to report; to denounce; to file a lawsuit; to sue

告一段落.definition: to come to the end of a phase (idiom)

告便.definition: to ask to be excused; to ask leave to go to the toilet

告別.definition: to leave; to part from; to bid farewell to; to say goodbye to

告吹.definition: to fizzle out; to come to nothing

告密者.definition: tell-tale; informer (esp. to police); whistleblower; grass

告急.definition: to be in a state of emergency; to report an emergency; to ask for emergency assistance

告戒.definition: variant of 告誡|告诫[gao4 jie4]

告捷.definition: to win; to be victorious; to report a victory

告狀.definition: to tell on sb; to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc); to bring a lawsuit

告白.definition: to announce publicly; to explain oneself; to reveal one's feelings; to confess; to declare one's love

告終.definition: to end; to reach an end

告罄.definition: to run out; to have exhausted

告訴.definition: to tell; to inform; to let know

告諭.definition: (literary) to inform (the public); to give clear instructions; public announcement (from higher authorities)

告辭.definition: to say goodbye; to take one's leave

告退.definition: to petition for retirement (old); to ask for leave to withdraw; to ask to be excused
